about_the_game:
It’s still a demo, and I’m not sure how people will react. If a lot of people enjoy it, I’ll invest more time into expanding the content.

Visible injuries have treatments and support, but many people live with emotional trauma for life. They pretend they’re okay, act normal, and often don’t even seek help. This story includes self-healing tips. I hope this story can help people with traumatic experiences.

If you’re interested in these topics, you can check out: Complex PTSD: From Surviving to Thriving (Pete Walker), Manipulative Parents (Isabelle Nazare-Aga), The Body Keeps the Score: Brain, Mind, and Body in the Healing of Trauma, (Bessel van der Kolk M.D.) and more.

--------------------------------------------------------------

Pigs and monsters have been locked in an unending struggle for thousands of years. Every century, a new pig rises to protect the peace of the bunny villagers, generation after generation.

Monsters have tried various methods to control the pig, including raising it alongside the monsters and instilling in the pig the monsters' world view from an early age, where bullying is considered right and fun. But in the end, the pig always awakens at the last moment and chooses to protect the villagers.

In a final desperate attempt, the monsters imprison the pig, isolating it from the outside world. They constantly belittle the pig, telling it that it's worthless and useless, that everyone mocks and ridicules it, and that the world is a dark and cruel place filled only with villains. Pig grows up in panic and fear, no longer believing in its abilities, losing all its skills to fight the monsters, and even doubting whether the world is worth saving.

A new season of battling the monsters is about to begin. However, Pig's best friend, the fluffy Bunny, has never given up on finding Pig. Bunny believes in the power of unconditional love to heal all wounds of the heart and soul.

--------------------------------------------------------------

Through interactive narrative dialogues, players must choose dialogues that can best heal Pig and help it believe in itself. Encourage Pig to step out of the darkness. The player, as the adorable fluffy Bunny, may not have combat skills, but can grow vegetables, bake delicious cakes, and give warm hugs.

The player leads wounded Pig to escape from monsters' captivity. With Bunny's help, Pig slowly grows along the way until the final confrontation with monsters.

--------------------------------------------------------------

Dialogue scenes are designed with cinematographic language.

content_descriptors.notes:
This game contains the following mature content:

❥ Mental health themes: 
The story explores psychological trauma, depression, and the journey of self-healing.

❥ Self-harm and suicidal thoughts: 
The protagonist experiences suicidal ideation, but the core message of the game is self-recovery and hope.

❥ Violent scenes: 
Some depictions of violence, such as the protagonist facing aggression, oppression, or abuse (non-extreme violence).

❥ Drug use: 
The game includes references to medication related to mental health treatment but does not promote substance abuse.

❥ The game’s main theme is overcoming trauma and finding hope, but certain topics may be emotionally triggering for some players. Please proceed with caution.

Minimum:
  • OS *: 64-bit Windows 7 or newer
  • Additional Notes: This game requires a computer with a mid-to-high level configuration to run smoothly.

short_description: An storybook. Themes: CPTSD, depression, anxiety, and more. Pig has endured years of abuse from monsters, leaving her with depression, CPTSD, and anxiety. But she escapes and begins to overcome her trauma, ultimately regaining her freedom and happiness.
supported_languages:
English*, Simplified Chinese*
*languages with full audio support
